verses.verse: When a man <S%H376><s%> taketh <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%>, and marrieth <S%H1166><s%> her <S%H4672><s%>, then it shall be, if she find no favor <S%H2580><s%> in his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, because he hath found <S%H4672><s%> some <S%H1697><s%> unseemly <S%H6172><s%> thing in her <S%H3789><s%>, that he shall write her a bill <S%H5612><s%> of divorcement <S%H3748><s%>, and give <S%H5414><s%> it in her hand <S%H3027><s%>, and send <S%H7971><s%> her out of his house <S%H1004><s%>.
And when she is departed out <S%H3318><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%>, she may go <S%H1980><s%> and be another <S%H312><s%> man <S%H376><s%>'s wife.

And if the latter <S%H314><s%> husband <S%H376><s%> hate <S%H8130><s%> her <S%H3789><s%>, and write her a bill <S%H5612><s%> of divorcement <S%H3748><s%>, and give <S%H5414><s%> it in her hand <S%H3027><s%>, and send <S%H7971><s%> her out of his house <S%H1004><s%>; or if the latter <S%H314><s%> husband <S%H376><s%> die <S%H4191><s%>, who took <S%H3947><s%> her to be his wife <S%H802><s%>;

her former <S%H7223><s%> husband <S%H1167><s%>, who sent her away <S%H7971><s%>, may <S%H3201><s%> not take <S%H3947><s%> her again <S%H7725><s%> to be his wife <S%H802><s%>, after <S%H310><s%> that she is defiled <S%H2930><s%>; for that is abomination <S%H8441><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>: and thou shalt not cause the land <S%H776><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%>, which Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> giveth <S%H5414><s%> thee for an inheritance <S%H5159><s%>.

When a man <S%H376><s%> taketh <S%H3947><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> wife <S%H802><s%>, he shall not go out <S%H3318><s%> in the host <S%H6635><s%>, neither shall he be charged <S%H5674><s%> with any business <S%H1697><s%>: he shall be free <S%H5355><s%> at home <S%H1004><s%> one <S%H259><s%> year <S%H8141><s%>, and shall cheer <S%H8055><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> whom he hath taken <S%H3947><s%>.
No man shall take <S%H2254><s%> the mill <S%H7347><s%> or the upper millstone <S%H7393><s%> to pledge <S%H2254><s%>; for he taketh <S%H2254><s%> a man <S%H5315><s%>'s life to pledge <S%H2254><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> stealing <S%H1589><s%> any <S%H5315><s%> of his brethren <S%H251><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and he deal <S%H6014><s%> with him as a slave <S%H4376><s%>, or sell him <S%H1590><s%>; then that thief shall die <S%H4191><s%>: so shalt thou put <S%H1197><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> from the midst of thee <S%H7130><s%>.

Take heed <S%H8104><s%> in the plague <S%H5061><s%> of leprosy <S%H6883><s%>, that thou observe <S%H8104><s%> diligently <S%H3966><s%>, and do <S%H6213><s%> according to all that the priests <S%H3548><s%> the Levites <S%H3881><s%> shall teach <S%H3384><s%> you <S%H6680><s%>: as I commanded them <S%H8104><s%>, so ye shall observe to do <S%H6213><s%>.
Remember <S%H2142><s%> what Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> unto Miriam <S%H4813><s%>, by the way <S%H1870><s%> as ye came forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

When thou dost lend <S%H5383><s%> thy neighbor <S%H7453><s%> any <S%H3972><s%> manner <S%H4859><s%> of loan <S%H935><s%>, thou shalt not go into his house <S%H1004><s%> to fetch <S%H5670><s%> his pledge <S%H5667><s%>.

Thou shalt stand <S%H5975><s%> without <S%H2351><s%>, and the man <S%H376><s%> to whom thou dost lend <S%H5383><s%> shall bring forth <S%H3318><s%> the pledge <S%H5667><s%> without unto thee <S%H2351><s%>.
And if he be a poor <S%H6041><s%> man <S%H376><s%>, thou shalt not sleep <S%H7901><s%> with his pledge <S%H5667><s%>;

thou shalt surely <S%H7725><s%> restore <S%H7725><s%> to him <S%H7725><s%> the pledge <S%H5667><s%> when the sun <S%H8121><s%> goeth down <S%H935><s%>, that he may sleep <S%H7901><s%> in his garment <S%H8008><s%>, and bless <S%H1288><s%> thee <S%H6666><s%>: and it shall be righteousness unto thee before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>.

Thou shalt not oppress <S%H6231><s%> a hired servant <S%H7916><s%> that is poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H34><s%>, whether he be of thy brethren <S%H251><s%>, or of thy sojourners <S%H1616><s%> that are in thy land <S%H776><s%> within thy gates <S%H8179><s%>:

in his day <S%H3117><s%> thou shalt give <S%H5414><s%> him his hire <S%H7939><s%>, neither shall the sun <S%H8121><s%> go down <S%H935><s%> upon it <S%H6041><s%>; for he is poor, and setteth <S%H5375><s%> his heart <S%H5315><s%> upon it <S%H7121><s%>: lest he cry against thee unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, and it be sin unto thee <S%H2399><s%>.

The fathers <S%H1><s%> shall not be put to death <S%H4191><s%> for the children <S%H1121><s%>, neither shall the children <S%H1121><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%> for the fathers <S%H1><s%>: every man <S%H376><s%> shall be put to death <S%H4191><s%> for his own sin <S%H2399><s%>.

Thou shalt not wrest <S%H5186><s%> the justice <S%H4941><s%> due to the sojourner <S%H1616><s%>, or to the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, nor take <S%H2254><s%> the widow <S%H490><s%>'s raiment <S%H899><s%> to pledge <S%H2254><s%>;

but thou shalt remember <S%H2142><s%> that thou wast a bondman <S%H5650><s%> in Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> redeemed <S%H6299><s%> thee thence <S%H6680><s%>: therefore I command thee to do <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>.

When thou reapest <S%H7114><s%> thy harvest <S%H7105><s%> in thy field <S%H7704><s%>, and hast forgot <S%H7911><s%> a sheaf <S%H6016><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%>, thou shalt not go again <S%H7725><s%> to fetch <S%H3947><s%> it <S%H1616><s%>: it shall be for the sojourner, for the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, and for the widow <S%H490><s%>; that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> may bless <S%H1288><s%> thee in all the work <S%H4639><s%> of thy hands <S%H3027><s%>.

When thou beatest <S%H2251><s%> thine olive-tree <S%H2132><s%>, thou shalt not go over the boughs <S%H6286><s%> again <S%H310><s%>: it shall be for the sojourner <S%H1616><s%>, for the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, and for the widow <S%H490><s%>.

When thou gatherest <S%H1219><s%> the grapes of thy vineyard <S%H3754><s%>, thou shalt not glean <S%H5953><s%> it after <S%H310><s%> thee <S%H1616><s%>: it shall be for the sojourner, for the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, and for the widow <S%H490><s%>.

And thou shalt remember <S%H2142><s%> that thou wast a bondman <S%H5650><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>: therefore I command <S%H6680><s%> thee to do <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>.
